testimonials.testimonial2Text: The booking system is so easy to use. I can book courts anytime, anywhere. Highly recommend!

testimonials.testimonial4Text: Finally, a platform that makes finding and booking padel courts hassle-free. Love it!

overview.title: Overview
overview.metaDescription: Learn what ArenaOne is, who it's for, and how it helps padel clubs operate more efficiently.

whatIsArenaOne.title: What is ArenaOne?
whatIsArenaOne.p1: ArenaOne is a cloud-based management platform built specifically for padel clubs. Whether you operate a single club or manage multiple facilities, ArenaOne provides the tools to streamline your operations, automate bookings, and maintain full control over your business.
whatIsArenaOne.p2: The platform centralizes everything you need to run your club: court scheduling, player bookings, availability management, and operational oversight‚Äîall accessible from a single, unified interface.

whoItsFor.title: Who It's For
whoItsFor.intro: ArenaOne is designed for padel club owners and organizations who need to:
whoItsFor.item1: Manage one or more padel facilities efficiently
whoItsFor.item2: Automate court bookings and reduce manual coordination
whoItsFor.item3: Gain real-time visibility into operations and revenue
whoItsFor.item4: Scale their business without adding administrative overhead
whoItsFor.item5: Provide a professional booking experience for their players
whoItsFor.outro: If you're currently managing bookings through WhatsApp, Excel spreadsheets, or fragmented tools, ArenaOne helps you consolidate and professionalize your operations.

whatItIsNot.title: What This Platform Is NOT
whatItIsNot.note: ArenaOne is your operational management platform‚Äînot a replacement for your brand or identity.
whatItIsNot.intro: It's important to understand what ArenaOne does not do:

notMarketplace.title: Not a marketplace.
notMarketplace.text: ArenaOne is not a public directory or booking marketplace. It's your private management system. Players book directly through your club's presence on the platform.

notReplacing.title: Not replacing your branding.
notReplacing.text: Your club keeps its identity, name, and customer relationships. ArenaOne works behind the scenes to power your operations.

notAggregator.title: Not a third-party booking aggregator.
notAggregator.text: You own your data, your customer relationships, and your revenue. ArenaOne is a tool for your business, not a middleman.

coreCapabilities.title: Core Capabilities
coreCapabilities.intro: ArenaOne provides the essential capabilities padel clubs need to operate efficiently:
coreCapabilities.item3: Centralized control for single or multi-club operations
coreCapabilities.item5: Flexible pricing and special date configurations
coreCapabilities.item6: Operational insights and visibility across your business

problemsWeSolve.title: Problems We Solve
problemsWeSolve.metaTitle: Problems We Solve - ArenaOne for Clubs Documentation
problemsWeSolve.metaDescription: Real operational challenges padel clubs face and how ArenaOne addresses them.

manualBookings.title: Manual Bookings
manualBookings.intro1: Many padel clubs still handle bookings through WhatsApp messages, Instagram DMs, or phone calls. This creates constant interruptions, manual scheduling conflicts, and errors that frustrate both staff and players.
manualBookings.intro2: Common issues with manual booking coordination:
manualBookings.issue1: Staff spends hours responding to booking requests across multiple channels
manualBookings.issue2: Double-bookings happen when messages overlap or get missed
manualBookings.issue3: No clear record of who booked what, when, or whether they paid
manualBookings.issue4: Players get frustrated waiting for confirmations or checking availability
manualBookings.issue5: Impossible to accept bookings outside business hours
manualBookings.solution: ArenaOne automates the entire booking process. Players see real-time availability, book instantly, and receive immediate confirmation. Your staff is freed from constant message management.

fragmented.title: Excel Spreadsheets and Fragmented Systems
fragmented.intro1: Running a club with Excel sheets, paper calendars, or a patchwork of disconnected tools leads to data chaos. Information lives in different places, nothing syncs, and finding answers requires checking multiple sources.
fragmented.intro2: What this looks like in practice:
fragmented.issue1: Court schedules in one spreadsheet, player info in another
fragmented.issue2: Revenue tracking separate from booking records
fragmented.issue3: No single source of truth when conflicts or questions arise
fragmented.issue4: Time wasted manually copying data between systems
fragmented.issue5: Risk of losing data when files get corrupted or overwritten
fragmented.solution: ArenaOne unifies your data in one platform. Bookings, courts, players, and revenue all live together. Everything stays synchronized, and you can access any information instantly.

visibility.title: Lack of Visibility and Control
visibility.intro1: Without a centralized system, club owners often have no clear view of their business performance. How many bookings happened today? Which courts are most popular? Who are your regular players? These questions shouldn't require digging through messages or spreadsheets.
visibility.issue1: Can't see booking patterns or peak times without manual analysis
visibility.issue2: Difficult to identify underutilized courts or revenue opportunities
visibility.issue3: No way to track player activity or booking history
visibility.issue4: Hard to forecast revenue or plan capacity
visibility.issue5: Staff makes decisions based on gut feeling instead of data
visibility.solution: ArenaOne provides real-time visibility into every aspect of your club. See bookings as they happen, understand usage patterns, and make informed decisions based on actual data.

multiClub.title: Managing Multiple Clubs
multiClub.intro1: Operating more than one club multiplies every operational challenge. Each location might use different processes, staff can't see across facilities, and you lack a consolidated view of your business.
multiClub.issue1: Each club operates as a separate silo with its own booking system
multiClub.issue2: No way to compare performance between locations
multiClub.issue3: Can't reassign bookings or share resources across clubs
multiClub.issue4: Reporting requires manually combining data from multiple sources
multiClub.issue5: Difficult to maintain consistent processes and standards
multiClub.issue6: Staff at one location can't help with another location's operations
multiClub.solution: ArenaOne is built for multi-club operations from the ground up. Manage all your facilities from a single interface, maintain consistent processes, and get consolidated reporting across your entire organization.

howItWorks.title: How It Works
howItWorks.metaTitle: How It Works - ArenaOne for Clubs Documentation
howItWorks.metaDescription: Understanding the ArenaOne platform structure and how it helps your club operate efficiently.

structure.title: The Platform Structure
structure.intro1: ArenaOne is organized in a simple, logical hierarchy that mirrors how padel clubs actually operate. This structure helps you stay organized, scale your business, and maintain clear control over your operations.
structure.intro2: The hierarchy flows from top to bottom:
structure.level1: Organization ‚Äî Your business entity (single club or multi-club company)
structure.level2: Clubs ‚Äî Individual facilities within your organization
structure.level3: Courts ‚Äî The actual padel courts at each club
structure.level4: Bookings ‚Äî Player reservations for specific courts at specific times

organization.title: Organization: Your Business
organization.intro1: At the top level, your organization represents your entire business. This is the umbrella under which all your clubs operate.
organization.intro2: For single-club owners, your organization simply contains one club. For multi-club operators, your organization contains all your facilities, giving you a consolidated view of your entire business.
organization.benefit1: See performance across all your clubs in one place
organization.benefit3: Manage staff who work across multiple locations

clubs.title: Clubs: Your Facilities
clubs.intro1: Each club represents a physical location with its own address, courts, and operating hours. Whether you have one club or ten, each is managed as a distinct facility within your organization.
clubs.intro2: At the club level, you control:
clubs.control3: Pricing rules and special date configurations
clubs.outro: This structure allows each club to operate with its own identity and settings while remaining connected to your broader organization.

courts.title: Courts: Your Bookable Resources
courts.intro: Courts are the actual padel courts at your club. Each court exists within a specific club and can be booked by players according to your availability and pricing rules.
courts.item2: When the court is available for bookings
courts.item3: Pricing for different times or days

bookings.title: Bookings: Player Reservations
bookings.intro: Bookings are player reservations for a specific court at a specific time. This is where everything comes together: a player selects a club, chooses a court, picks a time slot, and creates a booking.
bookings.item1: Real-time availability checks to prevent conflicts
bookings.item3: Recording who booked what and when

whyMatters.title: Why This Structure Matters
whyMatters.intro: This four-level hierarchy might seem simple, but it's intentionally designed to support how padel clubs actually work and grow.
whyMatters.note: The structure ensures that as your business grows‚Äîadding more courts, opening new clubs, or expanding to new locations‚Äîthe platform scales naturally without becoming more complicated to manage.
whyMatters.benefits: Key benefits of this organizational approach:

benefit1.title: Clarity:
benefit1.text: Everyone understands which club, court, and time a booking refers to. No ambiguity, no confusion.

benefit2.title: Scalability:
benefit2.text: Adding a new club or court doesn't disrupt existing operations. Everything stays organized.

benefit3.title: Control:
benefit3.text: You can manage settings at the right level‚Äîorganization-wide policies, club-specific rules, or court-level details.

benefit4.title: Flexibility:
benefit4.text: Each club can operate differently while still being part of your larger business.

together.title: Putting It All Together
together.intro: When a player books a court, they're interacting with all four levels of this structure:
together.step1: They select a club (from your organization)
together.step2: They choose a court (at that club)
together.step3: They pick a time slot (when that court is available)
together.perspective: From your perspective as the club owner, you see everything: which clubs are busiest, which courts are most popular, when peak booking times occur, and how your overall business is performing.
together.conclusion: This simple structure keeps your operations organized today while supporting your growth tomorrow.

bookingFlow.title: Booking Flow
bookingFlow.metaTitle: Booking Flow - ArenaOne for Clubs Documentation
bookingFlow.metaDescription: Understand how court bookings work from both player and club perspectives.

howWorks.title: How Booking Works
howWorks.intro: The booking process in ArenaOne is designed to be simple for players and transparent for club owners. Every booking happens in real-time, with immediate visibility for both parties.
howWorks.outro: This means no double bookings, no confusion, and complete control over your court availability.

player.title: Player Perspective
player.intro: When a player wants to book a court at your club, they go through a straightforward process:
player.step1: Browse available clubs and view courts
player.step2: Select their preferred date and time
player.step4: Choose a court and confirm the booking
player.note: Players see availability as you set it. When you block a time slot or mark a court as unavailable, it disappears from their view immediately‚Äîno waiting, no sync delays.

club.title: Club Perspective
club.intro: As a club owner or administrator, you maintain complete visibility and control:
club.control1: See all bookings as they happen, in real-time
club.control2: View upcoming reservations in your dashboard
club.control3: Know exactly which courts are booked and when
club.control4: Create bookings manually if needed (phone reservations, walk-ins)
club.control5: Cancel or modify bookings when necessary
club.outro: Every action is reflected immediately across the entire system‚Äîyour staff, your dashboard, and the player's view all stay synchronized.

noDouble.title: No Double Bookings
noDouble.intro: The system prevents double bookings automatically. When a court is booked for a specific time:
noDouble.item1: That slot becomes unavailable to other players instantly
noDouble.item2: No two people can reserve the same court at the same time
noDouble.item3: Your calendar stays accurate without manual intervention
noDouble.note: This happens behind the scenes, so you don't have to worry about conflicts, overlapping reservations, or manual calendar management.

confirmations.title: Booking Confirmations
confirmations.intro: Both players and your club receive clear confirmation of every booking:
confirmations.item1: Players get instant confirmation after completing their reservation
confirmations.item3: All booking details are visible: date, time, court, player information

changes.title: Managing Changes and Cancellations
changes.intro: Sometimes plans change. When a booking needs to be modified or cancelled:
changes.item1: Club admins can cancel or reschedule bookings from the dashboard
changes.item2: The court becomes available again immediately after cancellation
changes.item3: Changes are visible to everyone in real-time
changes.warning: Any changes you make are reflected instantly, so players always see the most current availability.

multiClub.title: Multi-Club Management
multiClub.metaTitle: Multi-Club Management - ArenaOne for Clubs Documentation
multiClub.metaDescription: Manage multiple club locations under one organization with centralized control.

why.title: Why Multi-Club Support Matters
why.intro: Whether you're running one club today or planning to expand, ArenaOne is designed to grow with you. Our multi-club capability is a core strength of the platform, not an add-on.
why.outro: This means you can start with a single location and add more clubs whenever you're ready‚Äîwithout switching systems or rebuilding your setup.

howWorks.title: How It Works
howWorks.intro: In ArenaOne, you create one organization that can contain multiple clubs. Think of your organization as your company or brand, and each club as a specific location.
howWorks.item1: One organization = your business or brand
howWorks.item3: Each club has its own courts, pricing, and settings
howWorks.item4: All clubs share the same organizational control
howWorks.note: You don't pay extra to set up multiple clubs. Multi-club support is built into the platform from day one.

centralized.title: Centralized Control
centralized.intro: As an organization owner or administrator, you have a complete view across all your clubs:
centralized.item1: See performance and bookings across all locations
centralized.item3: Manage staff and assign them to specific clubs
centralized.item4: Control who has access to what
centralized.outro: Everything stays under one roof‚Äîno jumping between different systems or logging in multiple times.

individual.title: Individual Club Administration
individual.intro: While you maintain central oversight, each club can have its own dedicated administrators who manage:
individual.item1: Day-to-day operations at their specific location
individual.item4: Pricing specific to their club (if needed)
individual.note: Club administrators only see and manage their own club. They can't access other clubs in your organization, which keeps operations secure and focused.

whoBenefits.title: Who Benefits from Multi-Club
whoBenefits.intro: Multi-club support is valuable for different types of businesses:

type1.title: Single-club owners planning to grow:
type1.text: Set up your organization once, then add new locations as you expand without rebuilding your infrastructure.

type2.title: Existing multi-location businesses:
type2.text: Consolidate all your clubs into one unified platform with centralized reporting and control.

type3.title: Franchises or partnerships:
type3.text: Manage different clubs under one brand while giving local teams the autonomy they need.

player.title: Player Experience Across Clubs
player.intro: For players, multi-club support means convenience:
player.item1: Browse and book courts at any of your club locations
player.item2: See all your locations on one platform
player.outro: This increases visibility for each club and makes it easier for players to stay within your network, even when traveling or exploring new areas.

gettingStarted.title: Getting Started with Multiple Clubs
gettingStarted.intro: Adding a new club to your organization is straightforward:
gettingStarted.step2: Click to add a new club
gettingStarted.step3: Set up courts, pricing, and availability
gettingStarted.note: Each club operates independently for bookings and scheduling, but you maintain full oversight and control from the organization level.

rolesAndControl.title: Roles and Access Control
rolesAndControl.metaTitle: Roles and Access Control - ArenaOne for Clubs Documentation
rolesAndControl.metaDescription: Understanding who manages what in your organization and clubs.

why.title: Why Roles Matter
why.intro: Running a successful club‚Äîor multiple clubs‚Äîmeans delegating responsibility without losing control. ArenaOne gives you different levels of access so the right people can do their jobs without interfering with others.
why.outro: Everyone sees only what they're responsible for. This keeps things organized, secure, and efficient.

orgOwner.title: Organization Owner
orgOwner.intro: The Organization Owner is the person who created the organization. This is typically the business owner or founder.
orgOwner.item1: The entire organization and all its clubs
orgOwner.item2: Creating new clubs or closing existing ones
orgOwner.item5: Access to all data and reports across every club
orgOwner.note: Think of the Organization Owner as having the master key‚Äîthey can access everything and make any decision across the organization.

orgAdmin.title: Organization Admin
orgAdmin.intro: An Organization Admin is someone you trust to help manage your organization. You can have multiple Organization Admins.
orgAdmin.outro: Organization Admins are useful if you have business partners, regional managers, or trusted staff who need to oversee operations but shouldn't be limited to a single club.
orgAdmin.note: Organization Admins can see and manage everything in your organization, similar to the owner‚Äîbut they don't own the organization itself.

clubAdmin.title: Club Admin
clubAdmin.intro: A Club Admin manages one specific club. They focus on the day-to-day operations of their location.
clubAdmin.item1: Bookings and schedules for their club
clubAdmin.item3: Viewing reports for their club only
clubAdmin.note: Club Admins are perfect for on-site managers or staff who need control over their location but shouldn't access other clubs or organization-level settings.

whyWorks.title: Why This Structure Works
whyWorks.intro: This role system gives you flexibility and security:

item1.title: Clear responsibility:
item1.text: Everyone knows what they're in charge of

item2.title: No confusion:
item2.text: People only see what they need to see

item3.title: Easy delegation:
item3.text: You can trust others to manage parts of your business

item4.title: Secure access:
item4.text: Sensitive data stays protected from unnecessary access

assigning.title: Assigning Roles
assigning.intro: You can assign roles to people as your organization grows:
assigning.item1: Invite someone and assign them as Organization Admin if they need full access
assigning.item2: Assign someone as Club Admin if they should only manage a specific club
assigning.item3: Change roles anytime as responsibilities shift
assigning.item4: Remove access if someone leaves or their role changes
assigning.warning: Always assign the minimum level of access someone needs to do their job. This keeps your organization secure and prevents accidental changes to settings they shouldn't touch.

single.title: Single club owner:
single.text: You're the Organization Owner. You might assign a Club Admin to your on-site manager so they can handle daily bookings and operations.

multi.title: Multi-club business:
multi.text: You're the Organization Owner. You assign Organization Admins to business partners or regional managers, and Club Admins to each location manager.

growing.title: Growing from one to multiple clubs:
growing.text: Start as the Organization Owner with yourself managing everything. When you open a second club, assign a Club Admin to your first location so you can focus on the new one.

takeaway.title: Key Takeaway
takeaway.note: The role system exists to make your life easier‚Äînot more complicated. You stay in control while giving trusted people the access they need to help your business succeed.

gettingStarted.title: Getting Started
gettingStarted.metaTitle: Getting Started - ArenaOne for Clubs Documentation
gettingStarted.metaDescription: Learn how to set up your padel club on ArenaOne and start accepting bookings.

intro.title: How to Start Using the Platform
intro.p1: ArenaOne helps you manage your padel club operations from a single platform. Whether you operate a single club or multiple facilities, getting started is straightforward.
intro.p2: This guide walks you through the essential steps to set up your organization, configure your clubs and courts, and open bookings to players.

onboarding.title: Onboarding Flow
onboarding.intro: Follow these steps to get your club up and running on ArenaOne:

step1.title: 1. Create Your Organization
step1.p1: Your organization is the top-level entity that represents your business. All your clubs, courts, and bookings will be managed under this organization.
step1.item1: Provide your business name and contact details
step1.item2: Set up organization-level settings and preferences
step1.item3: Define admin roles and permissions for your team

step2.title: 2. Add Your First Club
step2.p1: Each club represents a physical facility with its own location, courts, and operating hours.
step2.item1: Enter the club name and address
step2.item2: Add contact information and facility details

step3.title: 3. Add Courts to Your Club
step3.p1: Courts are the bookable resources at your club. Each court can have its own availability and pricing rules.
step3.item2: Specify court type and surface details
step3.item3: Set up pricing for different times and days

step4.title: 4. Set Working Hours
step4.p1: Define when your courts are available for bookings. You can set regular hours and handle special dates or holidays.
step4.item1: Configure standard operating hours for each day
step4.item2: Set special hours for holidays or events

step5.title: 5. Open Bookings
step5.p1: Once your courts are configured, you can start accepting bookings from players. The platform handles availability checks, confirmations, and scheduling automatically.
step5.item1: Enable online booking for your courts
step5.item3: Monitor reservations through the admin dashboard

ready.title: Ready to Get Started?
ready.intro: If you're ready to start using ArenaOne for your padel club, sign up to get access to the platform and begin setting up your organization.

step3.description: Review details and complete the booking instantly

overview.title: Welcome to ArenaOne Pre-Sales Documentation
overview.description: This documentation provides a comprehensive overview of ArenaOne's capabilities for different user roles. Select a role below to explore the relevant features and workflows.

selectRole.title: Select Your Role

rootAdmin.name: Root Admin
rootAdmin.description: Platform-level administrator with full system access and organization management capabilities.

orgOwner.name: Organization Owner
orgOwner.description: Owner of a padel organization who can create clubs and manage organization administrators.

orgAdmin.name: Organization Admin
orgAdmin.description: Administrator managing organization settings, clubs, and operational oversight.

clubOwner.name: Club Owner
clubOwner.description: Owner of a padel club with full control over courts, schedules, and bookings.

clubAdmin.name: Club Admin
clubAdmin.description: Administrator managing day-to-day club operations, courts, and schedules.

player.name: Player / Guest
player.description: Players and guests can search for clubs, view court availability, and make bookings.

overview.title: Root Admin Overview
overview.metaDescription: Learn about Root Admin capabilities in ArenaOne platform.

section1.title: What is a Root Admin?
section1.content: Root Admins have the highest level of access in the ArenaOne platform. They can create and manage organizations, oversee all platform operations, and configure system-wide settings.

callout.title: Key Responsibility
callout.content: As a Root Admin, you have full control over the ArenaOne platform, including the ability to create and manage organizations, assign administrators, and oversee system-wide settings.

subsection.title: Core Capabilities
features: Access all organization and club data

note.content: Root Admin access is typically reserved for platform administrators and should be granted with care.

screenshot.caption: The Root Admin dashboard provides a comprehensive overview of all organizations and key metrics

createOrganization.title: Create Organization
createOrganization.metaDescription: Step-by-step guide for creating new organizations.

section1.title: Creating Organizations
section1.content: Root Admins can create new organizations to onboard clients onto the ArenaOne platform.

callout.title: Platform Expansion
callout.content: Create organizations to onboard new clients and expand the ArenaOne platform.

steps.title: Access Organization Management
steps.description: Navigate to the organizations section from the Root Admin dashboard

viewOrgAdmins.title: View Org Admins

section1.title: Monitoring Organization Administrators
section1.content: View and manage all organization administrators across the entire platform.

callout.title: System-Wide Oversight
callout.content: Root Admins can view and manage all organization administrators across the entire platform, ensuring proper governance and security.

subsection1.title: Admin Management Features
features: View all organization owners and admins across the platform
Monitor admin activity and access patterns
Review permission assignments and role changes
Track admin login history and security events
Disable or remove admin access when necessary

subsection2.title: Security Monitoring
features: Real-time alerts for suspicious admin activity

note1.content: Root Admin oversight ensures that organization administrators operate within proper boundaries and maintain platform security standards.

note2.content: Use Root Admin privileges responsibly. All actions are logged and audited for security and compliance purposes.

callout.title: Organization Owner Privilege
callout.content: As an Organization Owner, you can create and manage multiple clubs under your organization.

subsection1.title: Steps to Create a Club
items: Fill in basic club information (name, description)
Add club location and contact details
Configure initial settings and working hours

subsection2.title: Required Information
subsection2.content: When creating a club, you'll need to provide:

note.content: Once created, your club will be immediately visible to potential customers on the platform.

addOrgAdmin.title: Add Org Admin
addOrgAdmin.metaTitle: Add Org Admin - Org Owner Documentation

section1.title: Adding Organization Administrators
section1.content: Delegate administrative responsibilities by adding Organization Admins who can help manage your organization.

callout.title: Delegate Management
callout.content: Organization Owners can add administrators to help manage the organization and its clubs efficiently.

steps.title: Access Admin Management
steps.description: Navigate to the administrators section in your organization settings

steps.title: Invite New Admin
steps.description: Click 'Add Administrator' and enter their email address

steps.title: Set Permissions
steps.description: Define what access level and permissions the admin will have

steps.title: Assign Responsibilities
steps.description: Optionally specify which clubs or areas they will oversee

steps.description: The admin receives an email invitation to join the organization

steps.title: Confirm Activation
steps.description: Once they accept, the admin account is activated

screenshot.caption: The admin invitation form with permission settings

subsection2.title: Admin Permission Levels
subsection2.content: You can grant different levels of access to organization admins based on their role and responsibilities.

note1.content: Admin permissions can be modified at any time by the Organization Owner.

note2.content: Organization Admins have significant access. Only invite trusted individuals with appropriate background.

accessControl.title: Access Control
accessControl.metaDescription: Manage user access and permissions across your organization.

section1.title: Managing Access Control
section1.content: Control who has access to your organization and what they can do with granular permission management.

callout.title: Granular Permissions
callout.content: ArenaOne provides a comprehensive role-based access control system to ensure security and proper authorization across your organization.

subsection1.title: Role Hierarchy
items: Organization Owner - Full control over the entire organization
Organization Admin - Manage clubs and settings with owner-defined permissions
Club Owner - Full control over assigned clubs
Club Admin - Manage day-to-day operations of assigned clubs
Player - Book courts and manage personal reservations

screenshot.caption: The access control panel showing role assignments and permissions

subsection2.title: Configurable Permissions
features: Assign roles at organization or club level
Create custom permission sets for specific needs
Temporarily grant elevated access for special tasks
Track permission changes in audit logs

subsection3.title: Best Practices
items: Follow principle of least privilege - grant minimum necessary access
Regularly review and audit user permissions
Use specific roles rather than blanket admin access
Remove access immediately when personnel changes occur
Monitor audit logs for unusual activity

note.content: Access control changes take effect immediately. Review carefully before applying changes.

section1.title: Organization Management
section1.content: Organization Admins oversee organization-wide settings, reporting, and operational management across all clubs.

callout.title: Organization-Wide Control
callout.content: Organization Admins can manage key organizational settings and ensure consistency across all clubs.

subsection1.title: Administrative Capabilities
items: View and update organization profile information
Review audit logs and system activities

screenshot.caption: The organization management interface with settings and analytics

subsection2.title: Reporting & Analytics
items: Track key business metrics across all clubs

note.content: Changes to organization settings may require approval from the Organization Owner depending on permission levels.

section1.title: Organization Settings
section1.content: Update organization-level configurations, preferences, and administrative settings.

callout.title: Centralized Configuration
callout.content: Manage organization-wide settings to ensure consistency and compliance across all clubs in your organization.

steps.title: Branding & Identity
steps.description: Set organization logo, colors, and branding guidelines for all clubs

steps.title: Payment Configuration
steps.description: Configure payment gateways, commission rates, and billing preferences

steps.title: Communication Settings
steps.description: Set up email templates, notification preferences, and SMS settings

steps.title: Booking Policies
steps.description: Define cancellation policies, refund rules, and booking restrictions

steps.title: Integration Settings
steps.description: Configure third-party integrations and API access

screenshot.caption: The settings panel with various configuration options organized by category

note1.content: Policy changes will affect all clubs in the organization. Review impact before applying changes.

note2.content: Some advanced settings may require Organization Owner approval to modify.

viewClubs.title: View Clubs
viewClubs.metaDescription: View and monitor all clubs in your organization.

section1.title: Club Overview
section1.content: Access a comprehensive view of all clubs within your organization, including performance metrics and status information.

callout.title: Multi-Club Oversight
callout.content: Organization Admins can view and monitor all clubs within their organization from a single dashboard.

subsection1.title: Club Management Features
features: View all clubs in your organization

screenshot.caption: The clubs dashboard showing all locations with key performance indicators

note.content: Organization Admins have read access to all clubs but cannot modify individual club settings without proper permissions.

crudCourts.title: Manage Courts
crudCourts.metaDescription: Add, edit, and manage your club's courts as a club owner.

section1.title: Court Management
section1.content: As a Club Owner, you have complete control over your club's court infrastructure, including adding, modifying, and removing courts as your business grows.

subsection1.title: Adding a New Court
items: Navigate to the Courts management section
Enter court details (name, surface type, indoor/outdoor)

screenshot1.caption: The court creation form allows you to specify all court details

subsection2.title: Editing Court Details
subsection2.content: You can modify court information at any time. Changes are immediately reflected in the booking system.

note1.content: Modifying court availability may affect existing bookings. Review active reservations before making significant changes.

subsection3.title: Removing Courts
subsection3.content: Courts can be deactivated or permanently removed from your club.

note2.content: We recommend deactivating courts rather than deleting them to preserve historical booking data.

workingHours.title: Working Hours
workingHours.metaDescription: Configure advanced scheduling features for your club.

section1.title: Advanced Scheduling
section1.content: Club Owners have access to advanced scheduling features including seasonal hours, dynamic pricing, and bulk schedule management.

callout.title: Advanced Scheduling
callout.content: Club Owners have access to advanced scheduling features including seasonal hours, dynamic pricing, and bulk schedule management.

steps.title: Create Season Templates
steps.description: Define different schedules for summer, winter, or other periods

steps.title: Set Date Ranges
steps.description: Specify when each seasonal schedule is active

steps.title: Configure Hours
steps.description: Set appropriate operating hours for each season

steps.title: Apply to Courts
steps.description: Choose which courts use which seasonal schedules

steps.title: Review and Activate
steps.description: Confirm and activate seasonal schedules

screenshot.caption: The seasonal schedule editor with calendar view and time slots

subsection2.title: Dynamic Pricing by Time
subsection2.content: Set different pricing rates for peak and off-peak hours to maximize revenue and manage demand.

note1.content: Dynamic pricing automatically adjusts based on time of day and day of week.

note2.content: Strategic use of seasonal schedules and dynamic pricing can increase revenue by up to 30%.

bookingsOverview.title: Bookings Overview

section1.title: Bookings Management
section1.content: Track all reservations and manage your club's booking operations from a centralized dashboard with enhanced analytics.

callout.title: Business Intelligence
callout.content: As a Club Owner, you get enhanced analytics and reporting capabilities to optimize your business operations.

subsection2.title: Financial Overview

section1.content: As a Club Admin, you have the ability to update your club's information, settings, and media to ensure customers have accurate and up-to-date details.

callout.title: Keep Information Current

subsection2.content: You can modify court details at any time, including:

workingHours.title: Working Hours
workingHours.metaDescription: Configure your club's operating hours and schedules.

section1.title: Setting Working Hours
section1.content: Configure your club's operating hours to manage when courts are available for booking. Set different schedules for each day and handle special dates.

callout.title: Flexible Scheduling
callout.content: Configure your club's operating hours to match your business needs, with support for different schedules per day and special dates.

steps.title: Access Working Hours Settings
steps.description: Navigate to the working hours configuration from your club settings

steps.title: Set Daily Schedule

steps.title: Define Time Slots
steps.description: Set booking slot duration (e.g., 60 minutes, 90 minutes)

steps.title: Configure Breaks
steps.description: Add lunch breaks or maintenance windows if needed

steps.title: Save Schedule
steps.description: Apply the schedule to make it active

screenshot.caption: The working hours interface with weekly schedule editor

subsection2.title: Special Dates & Exceptions
subsection2.content: You can set special hours for holidays, events, or maintenance days.

note1.content: Special date configurations override regular working hours for specific dates.

note2.content: Changing working hours will affect court availability. Existing bookings outside new hours will need to be addressed.

quickBooking.title: Quick Booking
quickBooking.metaDescription: Search for clubs and book courts quickly and easily.

section1.title: Quick Booking Flow
section1.content: Players can quickly search for available clubs, browse court options, select their preferred time slot, and proceed to booking confirmation‚Äîall in a streamlined, user-friendly interface.

callout.title: Fast & Simple
callout.content: Quick Booking allows you to reserve a court in just a few clicks. Perfect for spontaneous games or last-minute bookings.

step1.title: Select a Club
step1.description: Browse available clubs in your area or search for a specific venue

step2.title: Choose Date & Time
step2.description: Pick your preferred date and see real-time court availability

step3.title: Select a Court
step3.description: View available courts with details like surface type and pricing

step4.title: Confirm Booking
step4.description: Review your selection and complete the reservation

step5.title: Receive Confirmation
step5.description: Get instant confirmation via email and in-app notification

screenshot.caption: The quick booking interface shows real-time availability and court details

note.content: Your booking is confirmed instantly and the court is reserved exclusively for you during the selected time slot.

cta.text: Next: View Your Bookings in Calendar

section1.title: Court Availability Calendar
section1.content: The calendar view allows players to see court availability across different days and times, making it easy to find the perfect slot for their game.

callout.title: Stay Organized
callout.content: Your personal booking calendar keeps all your reservations in one place, making it easy to manage your playing schedule.

subsection.title: Calendar Features
features: View all upcoming and past bookings
Filter by club or date range
Receive reminders before your booking time
Quick access to booking details and directions

screenshot.caption: The calendar view displays all your bookings with color-coded status indicators

note.content: You can sync your ArenaOne calendar with your personal calendar app to get reminders on all your devices.

confirmation.title: Booking Confirmation
confirmation.metaDescription: Confirm and finalize your court booking.

section1.title: Confirming Your Booking
section1.content: Players can review all booking details‚Äîcourt, time, price, and club information‚Äîbefore confirming their reservation. Once confirmed, they receive a booking confirmation with all necessary details.

callout.title: Instant Confirmation
callout.content: Every booking is confirmed instantly. You'll receive immediate confirmation with all the details you need.

subsection1.title: What's Included in Your Confirmation
items: Booking reference number for easy tracking
Club name, address, and contact information
Date, time, and duration of your reservation

screenshot.caption: Your confirmation screen shows all booking details and options to modify or cancel

subsection2.title: Managing Your Booking
subsection2.content: From the confirmation page, you can:
items: Add the booking to your calendar

note.content: You'll receive a reminder notification 24 hours and 1 hour before your booking time.
